attributes.action: change the current method of calculating the end price of fuel for consumers: the current method adds VAT after Fuel Duty has been added to the retail price; VAT should be added to the retail price separately
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Currently, the cost of fuel at the pump (petrol and diesel) is charged according to the following formula:

Retail Price (RP) + Fuel Duty (FD) + VAT

This is iniquitous as VAT should be charged on the retail price alone, as it is for all other goods or services. 

The formula should be changed to:

RP + (FD rate x RP) + (VAT% x RP) 

This would end the double whammy of an increase in the retail price being doubly affected by the application of VAT on the RP + FD.

I have included examples of the effect this would have on a theoretical fuel price, current VAT and FD rates and my own personal costs based on prices @ 20 June 2008.

Example:
Current calculation: 
RP = £00.50 per litre
FD = £00.53
VAT = 17.5%
Net cost to consumer = £1.21 per litre

Proposed calculation: 
RP = £00.50 per litre
FD = £00.53
VAT = 17.5%
Net cost to consumer = £1.12 per litre

Based on my current fuel consumption of approx 51 litres of unleaded petrol per week for travel to/from work (90 mile round trip), this would reduce my fuel costs by approximately £216.2 per year 

(Based on current average price of £1.19 per litre / 90 miles per day journey in a 1.2l 3 yr old car that is up to date with servicing and driven very much with an eye on the revs!)
